what: Yet another R kernel for Jupyter
title: Yet another R kernel for Jupyter
text: re-creation scratch R kernel Jupyter. install run following lines R: {r} devtools::install_github("melff/RKernel/pkg") RKernel::installspec() dynamic help also need install python package jupyter-server-proxy. kernel differs already existing IRKernel : Users can decide whether objects certain classes output via “stdout” stream - allows using dedicated print()-methods via rich HTML/LaTeX output. default “stdout” stream used classes objects. Classes can designated rich output calling add_displayed_classes("class"). individual objects, rich output can requested using display(.object). Users can decide wether error calling stop() leads termination notebook run whether succeeding notebook cells run. (may useful teaching notebooks.) Whether error stop() leads notebook abort can controlled option rkernel_stop_on_error. Error warning messages appear via stderr stream, ordinary messages (created message()) appear via stdout stream. Consequently, “ordinary” messages (e.g. appear package loaded via library()) less obtrusive, error messages clearly stand . Graphics can “updated”, e.g. curve(gamma(x),add=TRUE) works expected even plot curve added created code previous cell. based R6 package instead S4 reference classes. Links help pages work. purpose, help pages paged, included notebook. also allows show several help pages notebook. Also help.start() now works. HTML help shown using jupyter-server-proxy polling loop allows providing services e.g. “htmluv” package. possible make use Widgets infrastructure provided ipywidgets constructed interactive user interfaces. can used jupyter notebooks, JupyterLab voilà. ipywidgets supported version 8.0. HTML widgets generally work. However, htmlwidgets (notably created plotly) displayed setting options(htmlwidgets_embed=TRUE) however appear notebook opened Google Chrome. also support virtual table display (based ipywidget infrastructure). demonstration notebooks can found . widget demonstration can found . TODO: Add documentation Make HTML help work servers Add example notebooks Make HTML widgets work generally
